title: Epic: Testing & Quality
description: Ongoing: integration tests, performance benchmarks, sample maps for validation.

title: Add performance benchmarks
description: Measure render times at various scales and map sizes.

title: Add integration tests
description: End-to-end map generation tests with known inputs and outputs.

title: Add sample maps for validation
description: Reference output maps for visual regression testing.

title: Epic: Output Generation
description: Map export formats: PDF, PNG/JPEG, GeoTIFF, multi-page PDF.

title: Add GeoTIFF export
description: Export georeferenced TIFF for use in GIS applications.

title: Implement PDF export
description:
Generate print-ready PDF maps with proper DPI for printing.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] PDF output at configurable DPI (300 DPI default)
- [ ] Correct page size (Letter, A4, or custom dimensions)
- [ ] Map scales correctly when printed at 100%
- [ ] Embedded fonts for labels
- [ ] PDF/A compliance for archival (optional)
- [ ] Includes margin content (title, legend, scale bar)
- [ ] File size optimized without quality loss

title: Implement multi-page PDF
description: Large areas split across multiple pages for field use.

title: Implement PNG/JPEG export
description: Export high-resolution raster images (PNG/JPEG).

title: Epic: CLI Interface
description: User interface: argument parsing, progress reporting, config file support, interactive mode.

title: Create CLI argument parser
description:
Parse command-line arguments for map generation options.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Uses System.CommandLine or similar for robust parsing
- [ ] Required: output file path
- [ ] Region input (one of): --mgrs, --bounds (lat/lon), --installation
- [ ] Optional: --scale (default 1:25000), --dpi (default 300)
- [ ] Optional: --format (pdf|png|geotiff)
- [ ] Optional: --cache-dir for tile cache location
- [ ] Help text with examples for each input method
- [ ] Validates mutually exclusive options

title: Add interactive mode
description: Guided map generation wizard for user-friendly experience.

title: Add configuration file support
description: Support YAML/JSON config files for default settings.

title: Add progress reporting
description: Show download and render progress to the user.

title: Add Camp Ripley as a location
Epic: MGRS Coordinate System
description: Core dependency for all map features. Implement MGRS parsing, encoding, and boundary calculations.

title: Implement MGRS encoder
description:
Convert latitude/longitude coordinates to MGRS grid references.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Accepts WGS84 lat/lon coordinates
- [ ] Returns valid MGRS string at configurable precision (1m to 10km)
- [ ] Handles edge cases at zone boundaries
- [ ] Handles polar regions (UPS) if lat > 84째N or < 80째S
- [ ] Round-trip conversion matches original within precision
- [ ] Unit tests with known lat-lon/MGRS pairs

title: Add MGRS boundary calculation
description:
Calculate bounding box from MGRS grid zone/square for map extent.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given partial MGRS (e.g., '18T' or '18TXM'), return full bounds
- [ ] Returns min/max lat/lon as bounding box
- [ ] Handles 100km grid square bounds correctly
- [ ] Handles 6째x8째 zone bounds for zone-only input
- [ ] Accounts for grid zone junction irregularities (Norway/Svalbard)
- [ ] Unit tests for various MGRS precision levels

title: Add unit tests for MGRS library
description: Comprehensive tests for coordinate conversions with known test vectors.

title: Implement MGRS parser
description:
Parse MGRS grid references (e.g., '18TXM8546') to latitude/longitude coordinates.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Parses valid MGRS strings of varying precision (4, 6, 8, 10 digit)
- [ ] Returns WGS84 lat/lon coordinates
- [ ] Handles all UTM zones (1-60) and latitude bands (C-X, excluding I/O)
- [ ] Validates input and throws meaningful errors for invalid MGRS
- [ ] Accuracy within 1 meter for 10-digit MGRS
- [ ] Unit tests with known MGRS/lat-lon pairs from NGA test data

title: Handle cross-zone MGRS boundaries
description: Properly handle maps that span multiple MGRS grid zones with correct grid line transitions.

title: Epic: Project Foundation
description: Initialize .NET solution structure, CI/CD, and documentation. Must be done first.

title: Add project documentation
description: Create README, CONTRIBUTING guide, and architecture documentation.

title: Set up CI/CD pipeline
description: Configure GitHub Actions for build, test, and lint automation.

title: Initialize .NET solution structure
description:
Create dotnet solution with appropriate project structure: CLI app, core library, and tests projects.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Solution file (.sln) created with meaningful name
- [ ] MilMap.CLI console app project (.NET 8+)
- [ ] MilMap.Core class library for business logic
- [ ] MilMap.Tests xUnit test project
- [ ] .gitignore configured for .NET projects
- [ ] Projects reference each other correctly
- [ ] Solution builds with 'dotnet build'

title: Epic: OpenStreetMap Data Integration
description: Data source for maps. Implement OSM tile fetching, caching, and Overpass API integration.

title: Add tile caching
description: Local cache for downloaded tiles to reduce API requests and enable offline use.

title: Implement OSM tile fetcher
description:
Download OSM tiles for a given bounding box at specified zoom levels.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Accepts bounding box (min/max lat/lon) and zoom level
- [ ] Calculates required tile coordinates (X, Y, Z)
- [ ] Downloads tiles from configurable tile server (default: OSM)
- [ ] Supports concurrent downloads with configurable parallelism
- [ ] Respects User-Agent requirements per OSM tile usage policy
- [ ] Returns list of downloaded tile images with their coordinates
- [ ] Handles HTTP errors gracefully with retries

title: Implement OSM Overpass API client
description: Query OSM Overpass API for vector features (roads, buildings, contours).

title: Add rate limiting and retry logic
description: Respect OSM API usage policies with proper rate limiting and exponential backoff.

title: Add elevation data source
description:
Integrate elevation data (SRTM, ASTER, or similar DEM) to support contour line generation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Downloads SRTM 1-arc-second (30m) or 3-arc-second (90m) tiles
- [ ] Caches elevation tiles locally
- [ ] Provides elevation query by lat/lon coordinate
- [ ] Returns elevation grid for bounding box
- [ ] Handles void data (missing elevation values)
- [ ] Supports at minimum CONUS coverage; global preferred

title: Epic: Input Handlers
description: Multiple input methods: MGRS grid boundary, lat/lon region, military installation lookup.

title: Implement MGRS grid boundary input
description:
Accept MGRS coordinates as input to define map boundaries.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Accepts single MGRS (generates map centered on point)
- [ ] Accepts two MGRS coordinates (SW and NE corners)
- [ ] Accepts MGRS with grid square only (e.g., '18TXM' = 100km square)
- [ ] Validates MGRS format before processing
- [ ] Converts to bounding box for downstream processing
- [ ] CLI examples: --mgrs 18TXM8546 --radius 5km or --mgrs-sw 18TXM0000 --mgrs-ne 18TXM9999

title: Implement lat/lon region input
description: Accept decimal degrees bounding box as input.

title: Add installation database
description:
Create database/JSON of military installation boundaries for lookup.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] JSON file with installation data (name, aliases, bounding box)
- [ ] Covers major US military installations (Army, Navy, AF, Marines)
- [ ] At minimum 50 major installations
- [ ] Includes installation type (base, camp, station, etc.)
- [ ] Data sourced from public/open sources
- [ ] Schema documented for future additions
- [ ] Easily extensible format

title: Implement military installation lookup
description:
Lookup known military installations by name to get boundaries.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Fuzzy search by installation name (e.g., 'fort bragg', 'Bragg')
- [ ] Returns bounding box for installation
- [ ] Lists multiple matches if ambiguous
- [ ] Supports common aliases (e.g., 'Ft.' = 'Fort')
- [ ] Data source: installation database (MilMap-q6y.3)
- [ ] CLI: --installation 'Fort Liberty' or --installation 'JBLM'

title: Epic: Map Rendering Engine
description: Core map generation. Combine tiles, render MGRS grid overlay, scale bars, military symbology, contours, and legends.

title: Add legend generation
description: Generate map legend with symbols and scale information.

title: Create base map renderer
description:
Combine OSM tiles into a single composite image for the map area.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Stitches tiles seamlessly without visible seams
- [ ] Handles partial tiles at map edges (crops correctly)
- [ ] Supports output at configurable DPI (300 DPI default for print)
- [ ] Memory efficient for large maps (streaming/chunked processing)
- [ ] Output image dimensions match requested scale at target DPI
- [ ] Preserves image quality without compression artifacts

title: Implement MGRS grid overlay
description:
Draw MGRS grid lines on the map with proper labeling.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Grid lines at 1km intervals for 1:25000 scale
- [ ] Grid lines at 100m or 1km intervals for 1:10000 scale
- [ ] Grid line color/style matches military map conventions (black)
- [ ] Grid labels on map margins (easting/northing values)
- [ ] Principal digits emphasized in labels (e.g., 85 for 385000m E)
- [ ] Grid lines properly projected (not just lat/lon lines)
- [ ] Handles grid convergence angle

title: Implement military symbology layer
description: Add military-style map styling and symbology conventions.

title: Add contour line rendering
description:
Render elevation contours on the map from DEM data.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Contour interval appropriate for scale (20m for 1:25000, 10m for 1:10000)
- [ ] Index contours (every 5th) rendered thicker/bolder
- [ ] Contour labels showing elevation values
- [ ] Smooth contour lines (not jagged)
- [ ] Brown/sienna color per topographic convention
- [ ] Depression contours marked with tick marks
- [ ] Uses elevation data from MilMap-mc8.5

title: Add scale bar rendering
description:
Render scale bar for 1:25000 and 1:10000 map scales.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Accurate scale bar that measures correctly when printed
- [ ] Shows both metric (km/m) and imperial (miles) units
- [ ] Alternating black/white segments per military convention
- [ ] Scale ratio text (e.g., 'SCALE 1:25,000')
- [ ] Positioned in map margin area
- [ ] Scales correctly based on output DPI

title: Calculate zoom level for target scale
description:
Given target scale (1:25000 or 1:10000) and output DPI, calculate required OSM zoom level and tile density to achieve accurate scale when printed.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Formula: meters_per_pixel = (scale * 0.0254) / DPI
- [ ] Maps to appropriate OSM zoom level (typically Z15-Z17 for these scales)
- [ ] Handles latitude-dependent scale variation (tiles are smaller near poles)
- [ ] Returns calculated ground resolution per pixel
- [ ] Warns if requested scale requires higher zoom than available (Z18 max)
- [ ] Unit tests verify correct zoom for common scale/DPI combinations

title: Add magnetic declination overlay
description: Calculate and display magnetic declination for the map area to support compass navigation.

title: Add map margin and metadata
description: Render map margins with: title, scale, MGRS grid zone designator, datum info (WGS84), declination diagram, and date generated.
